page.title: 04Conservation in Worlingworth
page.content: Q1People say that the rural environment is being destroyed by intensive farming What is left of Worlingworth? A1A few very important footpaths & hed- -ges. some ponds on private land(those on farms are polluted or filled).South -olt Green has never been ploughed. Plants on verges eg.Watery Lane,one or two copses.Many trees destroyed by Dutch Elm disease. Q2Who protects this environment? A2Suffolk Trust For Nature Conservation buy & maintain reserves,give advice & help protect land & verges.Farming & Wildlife Advisory Group advise farmers. Q3What changes would you expect in the near future to protect our heritage? A3New laws protecting special areas, less crop subsidies,financial help for farmers conserving land,media coverage to influence public opinion & educating tomorrow's farmers.
